SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.database

Class RestBroker<ID,T>

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.database.Broker<T>
ca.jolt.database.RestBroker<ID,T>
Type Parameters:
ID - The type of the entity's primary key.
T - The type of the entity.
public abstract class RestBroker<ID,T> extends Broker<T>
The `RestBroker` class is an abstract base class for managing CRUD operations on database entities. It provides methods for finding, saving, updating, and deleting entities, as well as querying by criteria. It uses reflection to dynamically map database rows to entity objects and vice versa.

    • RestBroker

      protected RestBroker(String table, Class<T> entityClass, Class<ID> idClass)
      Constructs a new `RestBroker` instance with the specified table name, entity class, and primary key class. The primary key column name defaults to "id".
      Parameters:
      table - The name of the database table.
      entityClass - The class type of the entity.
      idClass - The class type of the entity's primary key.

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      public List<T> findAll()
      Retrieves all entities from the database.
      Returns:
      A list of all entities.

    • findAll

      public List<T> findAll(int offset, int limit)
      Retrieves a paginated list of entities from the database.
      Parameters:
      offset - The number of entities to skip.
      limit - The maximum number of entities to return.
      Returns:
      A list of entities within the specified range.

    • findByCriteria

      public List<T> findByCriteria(Map<String,Object> criteria)
      Retrieves entities that match the specified criteria.
      Parameters:
      criteria - A map of field names to values to filter the results.
      Returns:
      A list of entities that match the criteria.

    • findById

      public Optional<T> findById(ID id)
      Retrieves an entity by its primary key.
      Parameters:
      id - The primary key of the entity.
      Returns:
      An `Optional` containing the entity if found, otherwise empty.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If the ID is null.

    • save

      public T save(T entity)
      Saves an entity to the database. If the entity has a null or empty ID, it is inserted. Otherwise, the existing entity is updated.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to save.
      Returns:
      The saved entity.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the entity is null.
      DatabaseException - If an error occurs during the save operation.

    • deleteById

      public boolean deleteById(ID id)
      Deletes an entity by its primary key.
      Parameters:
      id - The primary key of the entity to delete.
      Returns:
      `true` if the entity was deleted, otherwise `false`.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the ID is null.
